result.execSummary:
The defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with any other sentence;

superMiscConds.notes:
Work on obtaining HS diploma/HSED/GED. 
Obtain/maintain full-time work/school.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised the defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample. 
Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nacarrente Lamont Carr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Nacarrente Lamont Carr.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised the defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 34 MONTHS with 190 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 16 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Work on obtaining HS diploma/HSED/GED. 
- Obtain/maintain full-time work/school. 
- Complete a cognitive thinking program. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge during extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked from extended supervision, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

filed.

Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Nacarrente Lamont Carr in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
